data.title: Antone's
data.text: Having lived in Riverside many years ago Antone's pastrami sandwich was my favorite and when ever I visit  I make it a point to go to Antone's for a pastrami sandwich. It gets 5 stars from me

data.title: Do not miss this!
data.text: Real Italian food, real Italian owners, try the Mafia with double meat and cheese. Their pizza is scrumptious, one of my very favorites and the marinara is delicious! A local favorite!

data.title: Nice meatball sandwich
data.text:
I went here with my family while on vacation. We heard this was a nice local family place.

The sandwiches are big and made to order.  I did get the meatball hero, lots of meat very large.

They have hot and cold sandwiches.   This is a family owned and run restaurant for over 30 years.

It's small and quant, good value,  large sandwiches.

Enjoy!

data.title: Not all that great, could have been a lot better
data.text: This place isn't what people make it out to be. The location is pretty run down, the atmosphere inside does not feel inviting or clean. The food was really not that great for the price that was paid. Would not return and don't really recommend it to anybody. Subway has better sandwiches

data.title: Great Place for Lunch
data.text:
I have coming to Antone's for about 30 years..  This place is a landmark in Riverside.

Down home Italian food, nothing fancy, just good sandwiches, pasta, meatballs.

Friendly people in a small restaurant, family run, good prices and service.

data.title: A Riverside classic
data.text:
Antones in Riverside,Ca has been around for decades. In the age of the franchise it's great to see a family run eatery continue to thrive. 

Simple, clean, no frills but always reliable. 

Pizza, pasta and grinders make up the majority of the menu. Garlic bread on a sandwich is a unique offering. 

The cold sandwiches are good with the mafia having the most personality (ham,salami, provolone). The bread is the overall star. My preference is a bit more meat but you can't argue with their success and longevity. 

The meatball on garlic bread is the main attraction. If you are a first timer this is the sandwich to try. 

Service is always polite. Parking is adequate and prices are fair.

data.title: Mafia X garlic top
data.text: What can I say about Antone's? Same great sandwich just like it's been for the last 40 years. Yummy.

data.title: A LOCAL FAVORITE
data.text:
Antone's opened in Riverside in 1965.  They are a local favorite,  Their menu includes sandwiches, pasta dishes and pizza.  

However, they are best known for their homemade bread which is baked daily.  It has a unique flavor and texture.

The owners are a pillar of the community.  They seem to know everyone who comes in.

data.title: I would drive hours to get one of these sandwiches!
data.text: I have been eating at this place for 45 years and even though I live in Portland now the first place I hit when I'm in Riverside is Antoine's for a Mafia. You have to get your bread toasted with garlic butter it makes a regular sandwich something special. The owner is so awesome she will even do special requests for me! My wife gets the turkey and she goes everyday when she is in town she loves the food so much. It is the bread and the service that elevates the place to fantastic. I love this place thank you Rosanna for always taking good care of us!

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: Yeah good grinders. Not worth the price. You get ripped off. 7-8 bucks for a six inch grinder with 2 pieces of thin meat. The service isn't as good as it used to be and looking at the owner as soon as I walked in made me lose my appetite

data.title: Grinder history ...
data.text:
Stopped in for a grinder lunch ... he had the pastrami and I had the salami ... the insides of the grinder aren't what bring you in ... and bring you back ... it is the home made bread (which they won't sell ... I have asked!) that is perfection.  Bare basics ...
It is a fun place to go because you immediately recognize you are in an old house ...  you sit on old chairs at old tables ... kind of a funky Italian drop in place ... 
Fun to drop in every so often ...  and the taste of that roll ... Oh my goodness!

data.title: Pretty good meatballs
data.text: Wonderful for a simple lunch or quick supper of spaghetti and meatballs.  Very quaint atmosphere.  Has been in the same place forever!  Bare basics.

data.title: A favorite in Riverside for decades
data.text: My husband & his friends used to eat at Antone's while in high school in the 70's and according to him, they haven't changed a thing!  His favorite is the Mafia & I prefer the Club.  Small restaurant that is always busy during the week; call in your order if you are in a hurry!
